title: Add Channel Brand Kits
summary: Let users define reusable brand rules so every thumbnail stays consistent without extra decisions.

details.problem: Creators waste time re-deciding colors, text treatment, and composition rules for every thumbnail and series.
details.proposedSolution: Create brand kits tied to channels or projects and apply their constraints automatically during generation and assistant guidance.
challenges: Designing a simple UX that does not feel enterprise-heavy
implementationSteps: Add `brand_kits` table and associate kits to projects or YouTube channels
Update generation prompt builder to incorporate kit constraints consistently
Add UI to create, preview, and apply brand kits in the studio
Add assistant behaviors to recommend kits and enforce do-not rules
details.targetUsers: Creators running series and teams who need consistent thumbnails at speed.

title: Schedule YouTube Thumbnail Experiments
summary: Automate thumbnail swaps and performance windows so creators can A/B test without manual work.

details.problem: Manual A/B testing is tedious because swapping thumbnails and tracking timings is error-prone.
details.proposedSolution: Allow users to select finalist variants and schedule swaps via YouTube API with logged time windows and a simple winner recommendation.
benefits: Real experiments with minimal creator effort
Higher confidence in selecting final thumbnails
Clear upgrade story tied to measurable results
challenges: YouTube quota limits and API reliability
Attribution noise from external factors and algorithm changes
implementationSteps: Add experiment schedule model and cron-based executor with idempotency
Integrate with set-thumbnail and analytics endpoints to log windows
Build UI for selecting variants, cadence, and start time
Add reporting that explains results and limitations clearly
details.targetUsers: Growth-focused creators and teams who want systematic thumbnail testing.

title: Add Thumbnail Critique Coach
summary: Score and critique thumbnails with actionable fixes and one-click variations that address top issues.

details.problem: Users can generate many options but struggle to pick the best thumbnail and understand why it wins.
details.proposedSolution: Use vision analysis to provide structured critique and generate targeted variations that fix clarity, focus, and legibility issues.
benefits: Reduces wasted credits by improving first-pass quality
challenges: Ensuring critique is consistent and not overly subjective
Designing feedback that feels helpful, not harsh
implementationSteps: Add a critique API route that returns a structured rubric and top fixes
Build a UI panel to display scores, notes, and recommended actions
Add one-click generation actions that apply specific fixes
Track acceptance and outcome metrics to refine prompts
details.targetUsers: Creators who want guidance choosing a winner and improving design skills.

title: Enable Shared Team Workspaces
summary: Support creators and editors with shared assets, roles, and optional approval before publishing.

details.problem: Editors and teams cannot easily share faces, styles, and projects without duplicating setup or passing files.
details.proposedSolution: Introduce workspace tenancy with roles and shared libraries, plus an approval workflow for YouTube publishing actions.
benefits: Unlocks team and agency use cases
challenges: Requires tenancy and RLS changes across many tables
Migration path needed for existing single-user assets
implementationSteps: Add workspace tables and membership roles with strict RLS
Update assets (faces, styles, palettes, projects) to be workspace-owned
Add UI for workspace switching and member invites
Add optional approval gates for YouTube set-thumbnail actions
details.targetUsers: Creator plus editor teams and agencies managing multiple channels.

title: Build Smart Prompt Builder
summary: Guide users to strong hook prompts through a fast set of questions and reusable recipes.

details.problem: Many prompts are too vague or too complex, causing inconsistent results and wasted credits.
details.proposedSolution: Provide a guided hook builder that outputs a clean prompt and saves reusable hook recipes for recurring formats.
benefits: Higher success rate on first generation
Less user frustration and fewer wasted credits
Reusable workflows that scale across a content calendar
challenges: Must feel faster than free-form typing
Needs to complement the conversation-first interface
implementationSteps: Define a small set of hook dimensions (emotion, subject, text, background, constraint)
Build a UI wizard that outputs prompt plus custom instructions
Save recipes and integrate them into the assistant and generator
Add analytics to measure improved first-pass satisfaction
details.targetUsers: New users and repeat creators who want predictable, fast generation.
